programme.desc: Snapper season on the Gulf sees the wardens busy with fishermen who are breaking the law. Two men are investigated for cruelty towards a pig

programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: A puppy is found abandoned with a broken leg, and it seems Dr Jeff is its only hope of walking again. The team cares for a Boston terrier showing signs of a serious illness

programme.desc: When a potentially record-breaking python escapes Dustys grasp, his desire to catch it leads him on the most dangerous solo mission of his career

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: The Kilchers pay tribute to a fallen old friend by driving cattle back home, and Atz Lee prepares the Hunters Cabin in anticipation of moving further away from the homestead

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: The Browns flee the mountain during a dangerous lightning storm in the heat of fire season. To ensure their safety, they devise ingenious new fire safety measures

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Pete Nelson saddles up to build a treehouse with a Wild West theme. Set in a lone Douglas Fir on the range, he builds the structure with a county jail loft and copper ceiling

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Trischa Price investigates a report of a sick horse, but is confused when she finds discarded hypodermic needles nearby

programme.title: Winter Walks
programme.desc: Celebrities explore landscapes in Yorkshire and Cumbria. The Rev Richard Coles walks through the North York Moors and along the Sutton Bank. His journey takes him to the ruins of Rievaulx Abbey, once one of Englands most powerful Cistercian monasteries. where he reflects on the need for silent contemplation

programme.title: Winter Walks
programme.desc: Amanda Owen crosses hills and fields through Wensleydale and Raydale, taking ancient routes first made by the Romans and exchanging notes with fellow sheep farmers. Crossing over the dale, she drops down to Semer Water, ending her walk on the pebble banks

programme.title: Natures Weirdest Events
programme.desc: Chris Packham explores unusual and unexplained natural events that occur around the world during winter, enlisting the aid of leading scientists to uncover why these strange events happen. The programme examines unusual weather conditions, including tornadoes made of snow, and animals behaving in unexpected ways, from snowboarding crows to penguins attempting death-defying feats

programme.title: Leonardo
programme.sub-title: The Secret Life of the Mona Lisa
programme.desc: Alan Yentob tells the story of how Leonardo Da Vincis Mona Lisa became the most famous painting in the world. Admired by six million tourists every year, surrounded by bodyguards and encased in a humidified, air-conditioned box protected by bullet-proof glass, the enigmatic masterpiece has been stolen, vandalised and exploited over the centuries. With the help of leading scholars and original research, the subject of the portrait is finally revealed - along with the reason behind her inscrutable smile

programme.title: Britains Pompeii: A Village Lost in Time
programme.desc: Professor Alice Roberts joins the team excavating a 3,000-year-old Bronze Age village in the Cambridgeshire Fens that burned to the ground and was preserved in peat. Archaeologists also investigate the cause of the fire. Was it just a terrible accident, or did the villagers wealth provoke an attack?

programme.title: On Camera: Photographers at the BBC
programme.desc: The working practices, lives and opinions of some of the greatest photographers of the last 60 years, drawn from the BBCs archives. The programme brings into focus the key genres - fashion, portraiture, documentary and landscape - and the characters behind the camera who have helped defined them, including Norman Parkinson, David Bailey, Eve Arnold and Martin Parr

programme.title: The Magical World of Julia Donaldson
programme.desc: Celebration of the life and work of the bestselling childrens author, with animated sequences by long-term illustrator Axel Scheffler bringing her story to life. The film reveals the surprising stories behind iconic characters like the Gruffalo, Zog and Stick Man, and explores how her simple but poignant handling of themes of love, loss, fear and tyranny appeal to children and adults alike. Narrated by Julie Walters, and featuring readings from Donaldsons books by Helena Bonham Carter, Imelda Staunton and James McAvoy

programme.title: Winter Walks
programme.desc: Celebrities explore landscapes in Yorkshire and Cumbria. The Rev Richard Coles walks through the North York Moors and along the Sutton Bank. His journey takes him to the ruins of Rievaulx Abbey, once one of Englands most powerful Cistercian monasteries. where he reflects on the need for silent contemplation

programme.title: Winter Walks
programme.desc: Amanda Owen crosses hills and fields through Wensleydale and Raydale, taking ancient routes first made by the Romans and exchanging notes with fellow sheep farmers. Crossing over the dale, she drops down to Semer Water, ending her walk on the pebble banks

programme.title: Woolly Mammoth: Secrets from the Ice
programme.desc: Alice Roberts explores the natural history of the ice age mammals that once roamed across what is now Europe and Asia. Detailed information about their lives has been gleaned from carcasses preserved in the Siberian permafrost, and the anatomist meets scientists using genetic, chemical and molecular tests to reveal the adaptations that allowed mammoths to evolve from tropical animals to creatures capable of surviving extreme cold

programme.title: Natures Weirdest Events
programme.desc: Chris Packham explores unusual and unexplained natural events that occur around the world during winter, enlisting the aid of leading scientists to uncover why these strange events happen. The programme examines unusual weather conditions, including tornadoes made of snow, and animals behaving in unexpected ways, from snowboarding crows to penguins attempting death-defying feats

programme.title: Winter Walks
programme.desc: Alastair Campbell treks across the snow-covered hillsides of Ribblesdale in the Yorkshire Dales. Starting at a waterfall above the market town of Settle, the political veteran descends into town, meeting local residents who are also out braving the weather. Along the way, Alastair talks about his mental health and how time in this space can help him focus

programme.title: Christmas University Challenge
programme.sub-title: University of Hull v University of the West of England
programme.desc: Captained by actress Sian Reese-Williams, four alumni of the University of Hull face four graduates of the University of the West of England, led by science reporter Victoria Gill. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions

programme.title: Yes, Prime Minister
programme.desc: Jim has his first encounter with the Foreign Office and discovers they are something of a law unto themselves. He learns they are keeping reports of a communist coup secret and refusing to vote as he wishes in a UN debate on the Middle East. Comedy, starring Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: Yes, Prime Minister
programme.desc: Jim Hacker runs the risk of upsetting the Church of England by recommending one of two rather dubious characters for a new bishop. Meanwhile, Humphrey has his own reasons for wanting a third. Political comedy, starring Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.sub-title: Killer Storms and Cruel Winters: The History of Extreme Weather
programme.desc: Documentary following solar scientist Dr Lucie Green as she reveals how some of the UKs worst and most dramatic weather disasters occurred many years ago, despite the popular belief that the brunt of climate change has been felt in the 21st-century. Considering how many people today are pre-warned about potential catastrophes due to innovations in weather prediction, the presenter learns how an 18th-century storm surge once led to a the deaths of a thousand workers in Somerset fields, a hurricane drowned a fifth of Britains naval officers, and several brutal winters threatened to completely shut down most services in the country

programme.title: The Hidden Children of Ruinerwold Farm
programme.desc: The trial begins and the four older children unpack the painful allegations of physical, emotional and sexual abuse. They also meet their five younger siblings, all now young adults, who continue to support their father

programme.title: The Hidden Children of Ruinerwold Farm
programme.desc: As their fathers physical and mental state delays the trial, the four older children regroup, concerned for the welfare of their five younger siblings. First broadcast 31 October 2023

programme.title: A Slow Odyssey
programme.sub-title: A Slow Odyssey: A Cheetahs Hunt
programme.desc: Following the journey of three young cheetah siblings as they set out across the savannah in Namibia, with specially designed on-board cameras monitoring their progress. As they move through the acacia woodland, thorny scrub and open grassy plains they face encounters with animals such as zebras and warthogs that allow them to test their hunting skills

programme.title: Winter Walks
programme.desc: Alastair Campbell treks across the snow-covered hillsides of Ribblesdale in the Yorkshire Dales. Starting at a waterfall above the market town of Settle, the political veteran descends into town, meeting local residents who are also out braving the weather. Along the way, Alastair talks about his mental health and how time in this space can help him focus

programme.title: The Truth About Christmas Carols
programme.desc: Composer Howard Goodall uncovers the often turbulent and uncomfortable relationship between carols and the celebration of Christmas. Though around since the 12th century, the hymns have only been a feature of services for the past 150 years, as the Church believed them to be pagan or of no value. They have been used as secret codes, saved from the brink of extinction and subject to state censorship. The programme includes performances by folk star Bella Hardy, the Purbeck Village Choir and the Truro Cathedral Choir, who recreate the very first Service of Nine Lessons and Carols

programme.title: Leonardo
programme.sub-title: The Secret Life of the Mona Lisa
programme.desc: Alan Yentob tells the story of how Leonardo Da Vincis Mona Lisa became the most famous painting in the world. Admired by six million tourists every year, surrounded by bodyguards and encased in a humidified, air-conditioned box protected by bullet-proof glass, the enigmatic masterpiece has been stolen, vandalised and exploited over the centuries. With the help of leading scholars and original research, the subject of the portrait is finally revealed - along with the reason behind her inscrutable smile

programme.title: Life of a Mountain: A Year on Blencathra
programme.desc: Award-winning film-maker Terry Abraham returns to the Lake District to showcase the peoples mountain - Blencathra, looking at the lives of local residents, schoolchildren and tourists. Featuring contributions from comedian Ed Byrne, broadcaster Stuart Maconie, mountaineer Alan Hinkes OBE and record-breaking fell runner Steve Birkinshaw

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and Helen Skelton present the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Ben Fogle and Kate Humble go behind the scenes at Longleat House and Safari Park once more. The keepers work hard to get the animals ready for winter, and also introduce new residents, including binturongs, dik-diks and ostriches

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin, Tommy Walsh and Jacqui Joseph meet the new owners of a house in Hednesford, Staffordshire and two retail spaces in Norwich and Weymouth to hear about their development plans

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Roo Irvine presents a show from the Scottish Borders, and learns about the history of salmon fishing. Irita Marriott and David Harper help the teams at an antiques fair in Kelso

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC Newsline; Weather
programme.desc: Local news worth watching from across Northern Ireland

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Marvellous Miniature Workshop
programme.desc: A Glaswegian grandmothers childhood kitchen is lovingly rebuilt in miniature to help her reconnect with the tenement home - and the grandparents - she lost too soon. With no photos and only scraps of memory to guide her, miniaturist Abi faces one of her toughest builds yet

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Leatherworker Dani from Preston and calligraphy artist Masooma from London turn to Dom Chinea and his team of experts for help turning their hobbies into businesses. Theatre worker Dani fell in love with leather work three years ago but mentor Andy thinks she needs to celebrate the heritage of her craft and improve her techniques before taking her goods to market. Former finance worker Masooma moved from the middle east two years ago and needs some help reaching UK markets but mentor Claudia thinks shes not approaching the right locations and isnt charging enough

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Denise Nurse is in the Carmarthenshire countryside, showing a retired couple from Jersey some special homes, including one which comes complete with some beavers in the backyard. Along the way, Denise meets a couple who escaped to the county to open a tea shop

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.sub-title: Two-Faced Baby Soap, Garden Festival Glasses, Coconut Shy Box
programme.desc: The dealers come face to face with their creepiest item yet and enjoy all the fun of the fair. Plus, 10-year-old Cassie tries to pull their strings with her vintage puppets

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Charles Hanson and Roo Irvine go on an adventure around South Yorkshire, where they discover a 17th-century road map of Scotland and an art nouveau mirror

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts the quiz in which contestants try to record the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Stephen Mangan reveals the correct answers and comments on the players scores

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc: A High Court judge presiding over an organised crime case is badly injured after a fall, but witnesses report he argued with someone beforehand. As Luke issues Eve with an ultimatum, Clint struggles to keep the truth from Nicole. Marlene confronts Sasha about her secret relationship with Donal, and is offered a deal in return for backing off. Lois fears she has ruined her relationship with Seamie

programme.title: If Walls Could Talk
programme.desc: Larne Museum and Arts Centre, once a Carnegie Free Library, has now become the guardian of the towns heritage. Locals share memories of its library days and its transformation into a museum, which was led by local visionary John Clifford - a man with a passion for preserving the history of ordinary lives in extraordinary ways

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Sam Mitchell is back in Walford, and it doesnt take her long to cause trouble as she heads to No.55 to steal money from Phils safe. Jack makes a shocking discovery, Nicola tries her best to protect Harry, and Kat grows even more concerned for Zoe

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Richard Bilton reports on the rising number of potholes across the UK, and why many councils are struggling to stay on top of the problem. He talks to frustrated residents campaigning to get their roads fixed, insiders who reveal what they think is going wrong, people whove been hurt by potholes, and those who run and maintain the road network

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The contestants head back to medieval times in the semi-finals, preparing a banquet for 80 guests at Coombe Abbey, a former 12th-century monastery in rural Warwickshire. On their return to the MasterChef kitchen, they are challenged to impress the judges with a pie of their choice, before two are chosen to leave the contest

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: A Bump Along the Way
programme.desc: A 44-year-old single mother becomes pregnant from a one-night-stand, much to the shame of her buttoned-up teenage daughter. Director Shelly Loves comedy drama, starring Bronagh Gallagher, Lola Petticrew and Mary Moulds

programme.title: Shortscreen
programme.desc: Black comedy short following the story a dog who is accused of anti-social behaviour, directed by Adam Patterson and Declan Lawn

programme.title: Matthew Perry and the Ketamine Queen
programme.desc: Amber Haque explores the relationship between the Friends actor and Los Angeles-based drug dealer and dual US-UK citizen Jasveen Sangha - dubbed the Ketamine Queen by US prosecutors - who was one of five people charged in connection with Perrys untimely death, including two doctors and Perrys personal assistant. She pleaded guilty to five federal counts, including one of distributing ketamine resulting in death

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and Louise Minchin present the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: New binturong Baloo is settling into its enclosure and awaiting a first meeting with a new mate, but the Christmas tryst does not go to plan as the boisterous animal escapes

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph catches up on the development of five flats in Crystal Palace and Martel Maxwell is at a property with potential in Stoke. Tommy Walsh talks to a teacher who has a vision to create a family home in Bexleyheath that combines a modern feel while retaining period features

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion presents the show from Exeter and discovers a fine collection of postcards. Ben Cooper and Richard Madley assist two father-and-daughter teams

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Marvellous Miniature Workshop
programme.desc: Sara Cox meets lifelong friends Sue and Kathie, who want a miniature of Winford Hospital in Somerset, where they trained as nurses in the 1960s. Crafter Hannah Lemon recreates a ward and a sitting room, capturing the hard work, laughter and friendship of their youth - a heartfelt tribute to their bond and the spirit of the NHS

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Blacksmith Andy from Glasgow and willow weaver Ciara from County Fermanagh seek help from Dom Chinea and his team of experts in turning their talents into successful businesses. As an offshore engineer, Andy works three weeks at a time away from home then spends three weeks at home working on his craft but he needs to prove he can earn enough from his crafts to make a living. Ciara has only been willow weaving for two years but mentor Eddie believes with a bit of fine tuning she could make enough money to support her young family

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson joins two fitness fans hunting for a dream Cornish home near the coast. After some promising house tours, they all try a spot of gig boat racing in Padstow

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers presides as four sellers aim to get the best price for their items - a vintage poster from 1920s Paris, a football table, a globe and a box of ephemera

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Charles Hanson and Roo Irvine hunt for money-making items in Lincolnshire, where they discover a Victorian two-piece dress, a late 18th-century oak panel, a Murano glass bowl and a large leather horse. Roo also delights in checking out a cat cafe in Lincoln, while Charles is off to another realm at the citys castle

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts the quiz in which contestants try to record the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Stephen Mangan reveals the correct answers and comments on the players scores

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Clara Amfo and Alex Jones present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Denise takes matters into her own hands, Kat issues a warning to Zoe, and George and Nicola join forces. Sam tells Jack her health fears, and Anthony has a go at Patrick after discovering he has spoken to his ex-wife, Sophie

programme.title: Our Girls: The Southport Families
programme.desc: Documentary following the parents of the three girls who lost their lives in the 2024 Southport attack. Nine-year-old Alice da Silva Aguiar, six-year-old Bebe King and seven-year-old Elsie Dot Stancombe had excitedly gone to a Taylor Swift dance class but never came home, a tragedy that shocked the nation. This film follows the families journeys through unimaginable grief and the legacies the parents are now building in their memory

programme.title: Whats the Monarchy For?
programme.desc: Over the reign of Queen Elizabeth II, the Windsors amassed extraordinary private wealth without anyone really noticing. As a result, Charles was the first billionaire to take the throne. David Dimbleby shines a light on the secrets of royal money, revealing how Elizabeth oversaw the most lucrative change to royal funding in two centuries. He also puts George Osborne in the hot seat to ask why the monarchy costs the taxpayer more than ever before - and considers whether they are worth the public cost

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: Spotlight
programme.desc: Investigations into social and political issues affecting Northern Ireland

programme.title: Tommy: The Good. The Bad. The Fury
programme.desc: Tommy realises just how far he and Molly have come since the separation, but Johns worries grow as Tommy takes on a 100km triathlon, pushing his body to new physical limits. Before the challenge, Tommy takes some downtime at the spa with his mates, preparing for a huge press push ahead of his series premiere. After completing a series of intense physical challenges, he has to deal with a social media backlash

programme.title: Tommy: The Good. The Bad. The Fury
programme.desc: Tommy receives news of the untimely death of boxing legend Ricky Hatton, which reminds him to live life to its fullest. He then sets out on the most gruelling test of endurance possible - climbing the three highest mountains in England, Scotland and Wales in just 24 hours. At Halloween, Tommy and John go pumpkin picking with Bambi, things are back on track with Molly, and the house renovation is almost completed

programme.title: Michael McIntyres The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian hosts the quiz show with the giant spinning wheel, with Ed Gamble, Jonathan Ross, Liz Bonnin, the Rev Richard Coles, Jo Brand, Francis Bourgeois and AJ Odudu advising the contestants as they answer their way to a fortune

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: A tour of the worlds greatest landmarks, revealing how long it takes to build a pyramid, the controversy over the Statue of Liberty, and the pineapples of St Pauls

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: A look at some of historys most ridiculous rules, from William the Conqueror chopping off body parts to Elizabeth I in court over some swan-related mischief

programme.title: The Catch Up
programme.desc: A round-up of the days news

programme.title: Robbie Savage: Managing Macclesfield
programme.desc: Documentary following the midfielder as he takes up a management role at the club he helped create from the ground up

programme.title: Matthew Perry and the Ketamine Queen
programme.desc: Amber Haque explores the relationship between the Friends actor and Los Angeles-based drug dealer and dual US-UK citizen Jasveen Sangha - dubbed the Ketamine Queen by US prosecutors - who was one of five people charged in connection with Perrys untimely death, including two doctors and Perrys personal assistant. She pleaded guilty to five federal counts, including one of distributing ketamine resulting in death

programme.title: Fake Friend: The Ticket Scammer
programme.desc: The case of a Somerset high-flyer who turned his charm and connections into tools of deception, conning his friends and hundreds of others, while living a life of glamour himself. Through the voices of his victims and event industry insiders, this documentary uncovers the high personal and financial cost of chasing exclusivity, and how easily even the most cautious can be deceived

programme.title: Lara Croft: Tomb Raider - The Cradle of Life
programme.desc: The daredevil heroine returns on a new quest, this time to search the world for the legendary Pandoras Box. However, a devious scientist is determined to get his hands on it first and realise his cunning scheme to harness the boxs power as a deadly weapon. Action adventure sequel, starring Angelina Jolie, Gerard Butler, Ciaran Hinds, Chris Barrie and Djimon Hounsou

programme.title: Matthew Perry and the Ketamine Queen
programme.desc: Amber Haque explores the relationship between the Friends actor and Los Angeles-based drug dealer and dual US-UK citizen Jasveen Sangha - dubbed the Ketamine Queen by US prosecutors - who was one of five people charged in connection with Perrys untimely death, including two doctors and Perrys personal assistant. She pleaded guilty to five federal counts, including one of distributing ketamine resulting in death

programme.title: Tommy: The Good. The Bad. The Fury
programme.desc: After the success of his comeback fight, Tommys road to redemption hits a major setback - his hand is injured again and needs eight weeks total rest before doctors will know if he can fight again. The last time he couldnt train, his life spiralled out of control, so now Tommy throws himself into a frenzy of activity - a TV appearance on The Wheel, family days out with Bambi and a final push to finish the home he hopes Molly and Bambi will soon return to

programme.title: Tommy: The Good. The Bad. The Fury
programme.desc: Tommys recovery is back on track after he and John put his hand to the test. The pair are training again, and the search for Tommys next opponent begins. Eager to make the most of family time, Tommy splashes out on a £90,000 motor home for family trips with Molly and Bambi and takes his mother out for lunch and a long-overdue catch-up. Tommy reveals that John has had a recent health scare, so to cheer him up, father and son take their very different caravans to a local steam fair

programme.title: Press X to Continue
programme.sub-title: What Do NFTs and the Blockchain Mean for Gaming?
programme.desc: BBC gaming reporter Steffan Powel chats about forgotten titles, contemplating what NFTs and the blockchain mean for gaming

programme.title: Ashley Cain: Into the Danger Zone
programme.desc: Frances second-largest city Marseille has been the nations drug capital for over 50 years, but the violence of its drug war is escalating, as rival gangs kidnap, torture, kill and even set one another on fire. Ashley spends time in the notorious northern suburbs known as the cites, meeting young men involved in fighting the bloody drug war as well as riding along with the police on a night-time patrol

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Rattus presents a historical song contest, with international acts fighting it out for the glittering Ratovision trophy

programme.title: The War Between the Land and the Sea
programme.desc: Doctor Who spin-off, about a conflict between the human race and an ancient species of aquatic reptiles. An ordinary man finds himself caught in the conflict as the Thames reveals some terrifying secrets. Starring Russell Tovey and Gugu Mbatha-Raw, with Jemma Redgrave reprising her Doctor Who role as UNIT leader Kate Lethbridge-Stewart

programme.title: The War Between the Land and the Sea
programme.desc: Barclay becomes humanitys ambassador when the mysterious Salt emerges from the Tank. But his familys life is torn apart when Salt wreaks revenge upon all mankind. Doctor Who spin-off about a conflict between the human race and an ancient species of aquatic reptiles. Starring Russell Tovey and Gugu Mbatha-Raw

programme.title: Tommy: The Good. The Bad. The Fury
programme.desc: Tommy realises just how far he and Molly have come since the separation, but Johns worries grow as Tommy takes on a 100km triathlon, pushing his body to new physical limits. Before the challenge, Tommy takes some downtime at the spa with his mates, preparing for a huge press push ahead of his series premiere. After completing a series of intense physical challenges, he has to deal with a social media backlash

programme.title: Tommy: The Good. The Bad. The Fury
programme.desc: Tommy receives news of the untimely death of boxing legend Ricky Hatton, which reminds him to live life to its fullest. He then sets out on the most gruelling test of endurance possible - climbing the three highest mountains in England, Scotland and Wales in just 24 hours. At Halloween, Tommy and John go pumpkin picking with Bambi, things are back on track with Molly, and the house renovation is almost completed

programme.title: Matthew Perry and the Ketamine Queen
programme.desc: Amber Haque explores the relationship between the Friends actor and Los Angeles-based drug dealer and dual US-UK citizen Jasveen Sangha - dubbed the Ketamine Queen by US prosecutors - who was one of five people charged in connection with Perrys untimely death, including two doctors and Perrys personal assistant. She pleaded guilty to five federal counts, including one of distributing ketamine resulting in death

programme.title: Dating Apps: The Inside Story
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the Match Group, the corporation behind some of the worlds biggest online dating apps, and revealing the duplicity at the heart of the matchmaking services on offer. Surveys consistently find the majority of users are seeking long-term and serious relationships. However, this programme reveals how they have been sold a lie, and are manipulated in the pursuit of profit

programme.title: Licorice Pizza
programme.desc: In the San Fernando Valley in 1973, 25-year-old Alana Kane is going through the motions as a photographers assistant when 15-year-old child star Gary Valentine makes romantic overtures toward her. Despite the age gap, she agrees to go to dinner with him. Paul Thomas Andersons romantic comedy, starring Alana Haim, Cooper Hoffman, Sean Penn, Tom Waits and Bradley Cooper

programme.title: The Kim Kardashian Diamond Heist
programme.desc: The inside story of the 2016 robbery and its impact, with those close to the case revealing details about the crime for the first time. Featuring interviews with friends of the family, police officers and journalists who have followed the case, this documentary recalls the fateful night when the US reality TV star was robbed of millions of dollars worth of jewellery in Paris at gunpoint

programme.desc: Giovanna and Baby Bear welcome babies Theo, River, Arthur, Reece, Luna and their grown-ups to The Baby Club. Parents, carers, and their little ones at home are invited to join in with all the fun activities too! Giovanna has got a blue bib and blue sunglasses inside her bag. All the parents and babies have different blue toys and objects in their bags too, which are explored through play, songs and a story. Parents, carers, and their little ones at home are encouraged to hide a safe, baby-appropriate blue object or toy inside a fabric bag or pillowcase, and then play with the items together! The traditional nursery rhyme Little Boy Blue features, as does a story about Baby Bear and Baby Tiger dressing up in blue things, and viewers at home show how theyve been exploring the colour blue too. programme.title: My World Kitchen
programme.desc: Lolas family are from Spain, a country in southern Europe. She is making a traditional Spanish dish called empanadas for her and her friends. Lola begins by rolling out two pieces of pizza dough into big circles. She cooks one in the oven. Lola adds tomato puree to passata to make the filling. She also adds some canned tuna, green olives, and boiled egg. She seasons the mixture with paprika, black pepper and her special ingredient, oregano. Then Lola spreads the filling over the dough, which has been in the oven. She finishes the recipe by adding the last piece of dough on top and then putting it back in the oven to cook. Will Lolas friends find the empanadas tasty? Will they guess her special ingredient? Theres a very exciting Spanish surprise waiting for her friends while they enjoy their meal!

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The Squirrels are admiring everything Duggee has grown in his vegetable garden, especially his crop of giant carrots, when they hear a noise. They investigate and find the Rabbits busy preparing for the Carrot Solstice, the day when the sun is at its highest. On this day, they gather round Carrot Henge to celebrate the glory of this humble vegetable. Trouble is, the Rabbits need to go and get ready - but who will look after the carrots? The Squirrels volunteer, so off the Rabbits go. Looking after the carrots seems easy at first, and Norrie arranges tasks for everyone. Betty skillfully organises the queue while Roly is on toilet duty. And then, disaster strikes. Worm pops up and eats part of Carrot Henge. Duggee is dispatched to fetch one of his own giant carrots to fill the gap. As time ticks on with no Duggee in sight, the place gets busier, and the sun is nearly at the top. Will Duggee fix the Henge in time, or will Carrot Solstice be ruined?

programme.desc: Four of the countrys top knitters prepare to unveil their handmade knits. First, however, they need to compete against the clock, and each other, in the timed challenge. programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody: A Family Vendetta
programme.desc: Part one of a two-part special. Police receive a 999 call to an address in the quiet Cambridgeshire village of Bluntisham after a man has been fatally shot. Within minutes, a new emergency call is received for another shooting in another village just a 10-minute drive away. The new victim is the father of the first man found dead. Detectives establish that the motive for the double murder could lie in a dispute over who should have custody of the child of the first victim

Plus, motocross rider Carl needs Thames Valley air ambulances help after an accident leaves him with a dislocated hip

programme.title: Cancer Detectives: Finding the Cures
programme.desc: The work of Manchester-based professor Caroline Dive, who is developing innovative blood tests to detect cancer, well before its visible on a scan. She is looking for tiny fragments of cancer DNA in the blood, which is comparable to searching for a needle in a haystack. Her innovative tests will also give clues on how to treat cancer, and in some cases cure. Taking part in her clinical trials are mechanic Lee, a medical mystery as doctors cant find where his cancer started, and Damian, who hopes to discover if his recent skin cancer will come back so he can move on with family life

programme.title: Secrets of the Royal Palaces
programme.desc: Behind-the-scenes tales of Kensington Palace, which started out as Nottingham House until it was bought in 1698 by William III and transformed into a royal residence after a major renovation. Kate Williams explores some of the more gruesome pieces of palace history, including the grim death of Henry Stuart, the murder of Amy Robsart to clear a path for the queen, and the amazing story of Eleanor Cobham, the Royal Witch

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britains Speeders
programme.desc: In Sunderland, PC Will Hunter stops a driver who is dangerously overtaking other vehicles and gets out the breathalyser. Outside Newcastle, PC Brian Camsell stops a car with suspected cloned number plates, with the driver claiming to have bought the car that morning for cash - with no receipt. But a search of the car reveals a set of number plates and accessories often favoured by thieves

programme.title: Twisted Sisters: Madness and Manslaughter
programme.desc: First of a two-part documentary exploring one of the strangest cases in modern British history In May 2008, Swedish twin sisters Ursula and Sabina Eriksson travelled to England and caused carnage by running repeatedly into traffic on a busy stretch of the M6 in an apparent suicide pact. While Ursula was air lifted to hospital for emergency surgery, Sabina was arrested and held in custody, but an unnerving comment she made while in custody soon took on a dark dimension

programme.title: Twisted Sisters: Madness and Manslaughter
programme.desc: Concluding part of the documentary. Sabina Eriksson is released from custody and meets 54-year-old Glenn Hollinshead, who offers her a place to stay. The next day he is found stabbed to death in his home and Sabina goes on the run before jumping off a footbridge over the A50, but she is arrested and goes for trial. With testimony from those involved in the case, including the prosecution lawyer, as well as those who spent time with Sabina, this film follows the lead-up to her trial and hears from the victims brothers about the devastating impact it had on their family

programme.title: Police Interceptors

Gordons help is urgently needed to get customers back through the door, but the restaurateur does not take kindly to criticism and closes the restaurant down when his employees turn on him

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Beverly is pitted against a rival mother when she tries to micro-manage Barry and Ericas search for college places, while Erica tells Pops that she has tried to enhance her prospects by lying about her extracurricular activities. Comedy, starring Wendi McLendon-Covey and Jeff Garlin

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Adam plans to attend the school dance with Dana, and reluctantly agrees to take dancing lessons with Beverly. Meanwhile, Murray is forced to have the talk with Adam, but he admits that he hasnt spoken to Barry about sex yet. Comedy, starring Wendi McLendon-Covey and Jeff Garlin

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The family goes on holiday to Niagara Falls, where a mix-up sees Lisa mistakenly granted asylum in Canada and Marge has to come to her daughters rescue

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Mr Burns cuts health care benefits for his employees, so Marge buys healing crystals to treat Barts ADD and decides to sell them to support her family when they appear to work

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Cut off from his fathers fortune, Raj struggles to balance his books, so decides to appoint Sheldon to organise his finances and get him out of debt. Penny considers joining the guys at Comic-Con because she thinks Leonard wants her to come along

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Penny offer Sheldons old room to Raj after he is forced to move out of his apartment to save money, leading to unexpected conflict among the gang and some unwanted observations from Leonards mother. Christine Baranski guests

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Bad moods must be catching when Phil and Jay spend the afternoon together. Meanwhile, Gloria teaches Haley how to stand up to her boss. Starring Ed ONeill and Julie Bowen

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: While Alex goes head-to-head with a school rival, Gloria prepares for her US citizenship test, only to be thrown off her game by Javier. American comedy following the lives of three dysfunctional households - a man who struggles to keep up with his younger wife, an embarrassing husband and a gay couple getting used to parenthood after adopting a Vietnamese baby. Starring Ed ONeill and Julie Bowen

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon agrees to participate in a series of short lectures at the university, but is worried the students dislike him. Following Amys advice, he asks Penny to give him acting lessons to help him engage with his audience. Elsewhere, Raj fantasises about his best friends partner. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard is forced to consider how far he is willing to push himself in the name of science when a wealthy benefactor makes an indecent proposal. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, with Jessica Walter (Arrested Development) and Joshua Malina (The West Wing)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard is torn between his relationship with Bernadette and pleasing his mother - and comes up with a solution that leaves everyone unsatisfied. Leonard rekindles his romance with Rajs sister Priya, while Amy uses Pennys emotions as the basis for a research project

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon decides to make a new set of friends as he is depressed that the groups social world revolves around Leonard rather than himself. Meanwhile, Amy and Bernadette try to persuade Penny to go on a date. Comedy, guest starring LeVar Burton, with Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Mayim Bialik

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: A Race of Superhumans and a Letter to Alf
programme.desc: Missy unknowingly becomes Sheldons test subject when he agrees to help her with her maths homework, while Georgie joins Marys bible study group to spend more time with a girl he has his eye on

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: A Tummy Ache and a Whale of a Metaphor
programme.desc: When Sheldon becomes ill and spends a few days in hospital, he turns into the worlds worst patient. His behaviour takes a toll on everyone, and Missy gets a taste of what her life would be like if she didnt have a twin

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge signs Homer and Bart up on a father-son bonding ocean voyage in a bid to heal their troubled relationship, and while the pair are away takes over Homers fantasy football league. Animation, featuring the voice of Nick Offerman (Parks and Recreation)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge starts her own sandwich shop after her snacks become a huge hit at Springfield Elementary. However, running a business proves challenging - especially when the same franchise opens another location across the street

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Comic-book store owner Stuart asks Amy out on a date, forcing a jealous Sheldon to consider the future of his relationship with her. Meanwhile, the scientists become obsessed with an unusual new card game, and Penny organises a round of Twister. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Mayim Bialik

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard confronts the man who tormented him in high school, while Penny realises she did her fair share of bullying in the past and calls the people she targeted to apologise. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is uninterested in Amys career, so Penny, Raj and Leonard try to make him understand that sometimes it benefits a relationship to pretend to care about a partners achievements. Howard notices Bernadette is uncomfortable around children when she helps him perform a magic show at his nephews birthday party

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard asks Penny out on a date, and they agree to give their relationship another chance. They soon remember why it did not work out in the first place, but end up sleeping together anyway. The 100th episode of the comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: As the Thanksgiving holiday approaches, Mr Burns hires Homer to amuse him by playing pranks on all and sundry - a situation that upsets Lisa, who has all sorts of old-fashioned ideas about dignity being more important than money

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer starts his own web page and begins revealing the intimate secrets of everyone in Springfield - but ends up making powerful enemies who imprison him on an island. Featuring the voice of Patrick McGoohan

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Darren extends an olive branch to Tony. Cleo receives some bittersweet news. And, now that they feel safe, a resident opens up about recent abuse

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart, Milhouse, Nelson and Ralph are discovered by record producer LT Smash and recruited as singers in a boy band, but Lisa begins to suspect the moguls motives may not be entirely above board. Featuring the guest voices of N Sync

programme.title: The Great Celebrity Bake Off for Stand Up to Cancer
programme.desc: Hosts Noel Fielding and Alison Hammond welcome Dermot OLeary, Greg James, Fern Brady and Mel B to the tent, as they put their baking skills to the test, under the watchful eyes of judges Paul Hollywood and Prue Leith. The celebs take on iced buns in the Signature, a family classic in the Technical and a Showstopper where they create their celebrity doppelganger in biscuit form

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, including Great Expectations, Rise and Fall, Wild Isles, Dance 100, Tempting Fortune, Married at First Sight Australia and Project Icon: The UKs Next Music Star. They also watch the news coverage of an asteroid passing between the Earth and the moon. First shown in March 2023

programme.title: Dating Naked UK
programme.desc: A naked newbie is thrown into the mix, turning heads and threatening budding relationships. Tensions boil and one dater is dumped for good

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Zoe from London is confident but is finding it hard to meet someone who will embrace her sass and body hair. Derry from Wigan says his jet-set lifestyle is getting in the way of finding someone to settle down with. Anna Richardson invites them both to choose a date from a selection of six naked people, whose bodies are revealed one section at a time

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is dismayed when the group spends the Thanksgiving holiday at Mrs Wolowitzs house, but hits it off with Bernadettes father. Meanwhile, Penny realises she must deal with a mistake from her past when she and Leonard have an argument. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is bothered by the attention he receives in the wake of his heavy element discovery, but is taken aback when his work is disproved by Leonard. Meanwhile, Raj makes Howard and Bernadette feel inadequate when he stays with them for a week and is the perfect house guest

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Dental nurse Jade, whos 25, is set up on a date with handsome tree surgeon Tom. Meanwhile, Sharran - the UKs only female sumo wrestler - meets David, a former bingo-caller, who has been unlucky in love in the past, and City trader Adam is set up on a date with 28-year-old party girl Leena from Liverpool

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa joins an environmental protection group and begins campaigning in a last-ditch attempt to prevent the citys oldest redwood tree being felled by a rich Texan. With the voice of Joshua Jackson

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Haley and Dylans plan to quietly elope before the babies are born doesnt go as smoothly as they had hoped. Meanwhile, Jay continues to try to get his new business off the ground by courting an Instagram celebrity

programme.desc: Dancer and actress Raffie Julien becomes the mentor she never had and podcasters Sarah and Kirsty Jade hit a legendary UK nightclub on a game-changing mission

programme.title: Fire Down Below
programme.desc: Felix and Tony run a tramp steamer together in the West Indies, but their seemingly unshakeable friendship is tossed aside when they both fall in love with the same woman. Tony tries to undermine his rival by exposing his illegal activities, while Felix responds with deadly intent. Romantic drama, starring Rita Hayworth, Robert Mitchum and Jack Lemmon.

programme.title: The Sound Barrier
programme.desc: An aircraft manufacturer risks alienating his friends and family in a single-minded attempt to prove planes can exceed the speed of sound. David Leans drama, written by Terence Rattigan and starring Ralph Richardson, Ann Todd, Nigel Patrick, Dinah Sheridan and Denholm Elliott

programme.title: Film4 Interview Programmes
programme.desc: Stars and directors talk about the experience of making movies in this compendium of personal and practical reflections

programme.title: Young Winston
programme.desc: Biopic of Winston Churchill, following the future prime ministers formative years. While working as a journalist, he travels to Africa to report on the Boer Wars, an assignment that leads to his incarceration in a prison camp. He escapes from captivity and returns to England to begin a political career. Directed by Richard Attenborough and starring Simon Ward, Anthony Hopkins, Anne Bancroft and Robert Shaw

programme.title: Film4 Interview Programmes
programme.desc: Stars and directors talk about the experience of making movies in this compendium of personal and practical reflections

programme.title: Hunter Killer
programme.desc: Unconventional submarine skipper Joe Glass is sent to investigate the torpedoing of US and Russian vessels. He winds up trying to rescue the Russian president, who has been kidnapped by a rogue general. Action thriller, starring Gerard Butler, Gary Oldman and Common

programme.title: The Kings Man
programme.desc: Haunted by the death of his wife Emily, the Duke of Oxford is an ardent pacifist, who has established a network of servant spies coordinated by his housekeeper Polly to relay intelligence that will prevent conflicts around the world. When a shadowy mastermind known as the Shepherd orders the assassination of the Archduke Ferdinand, the Duke rallies his troops including right-hand-man Shola and his headstrong 17-year-old son Conrad. Action adventure prequel, starring Ralph Fiennes, Gemma Arterton, Rhys Ifans and Harris Dickinson

programme.title: Old
programme.desc: A vacationing family discovers that the secluded beach where theyre relaxing for a few hours is somehow causing them to age rapidly, reducing their entire lives into a single day. M Night Shyamalans horror, starring Gael Garcia Bernal, Vicky Krieps and Rufus Sewell

programme.title: The Missionary
programme.desc: A naive clergyman suffers various unfortunate temptations while trying to raise funds for an East End mission for fallen women. Comedy, starring Michael Palin, Maggie Smith, Denholm Elliott and Trevor Howard

programme.title: The Wrong Box
programme.desc: Two elderly brothers each stand to inherit a fortune if the other dies first - but one of them is not prepared to leave anything to chance, and begins a series of disastrous attempts on his unsuspecting siblings life. However, when one of the pair appears to have really died, his nephews conspire to cover it up. Black comedy, with John Mills, Ralph Richardson, Michael Caine, Peter Cook and Dudley Moore

programme.title: Far from the Madding Crowd
programme.desc: A beautiful woman arouses the ardour of three rival suitors in 19th-century rural Dorset and, having flirted and toyed with their affections, she chooses to marry a caddish, gambling soldier - a decision that leads to a sequence of harrowing events. John Schlesingers adaptation of Thomas Hardys classic novel, with Julie Christie, Alan Bates, Terence Stamp and Peter Finch

programme.title: All the Kings Men
programme.desc: A small-town senator wins popular support by railing against the corruption of the political establishment and vowing to defend the interests of ordinary working people. However, once in office, he succumbs to greed as readily as those he once so virulently condemned. Political drama, starring Broderick Crawford, Joanne Dru, John Ireland and Mercedes McCambridge

programme.title: Cowboys and Aliens
programme.desc: A Wild-West town dominated by a cattle baron comes under attack by invaders from another world. It falls to a mysterious stranger with no memory to unite the townsfolk, a gang of outlaws and an Apache tribe, in a bid to fight back against the aliens, and learn the truth about his own past. Sci-fi Western, with Daniel Craig, Harrison Ford, Olivia Wilde and Sam Rockwell

programme.title: Transporter 3
programme.desc: Underworld courier Frank Martins latest assignment involves transporting the kidnapped daughter of a crooked government minister across Europe on behalf of an eco-terrorist faction. However, a device will kill him if he leaves his car, thugs employed by the politician are out to murder him, and his passenger has a bad case of Stockholm syndrome. Action thriller sequel, with Jason Statham and Natalya Rudakova

programme.title: Meet the Fockers
programme.desc: A hapless groom-to-be appears to have finally won the approval of his stern prospective in-laws, but faces a new challenge when he takes them on a vacation to Florida to meet his free-spirited sex therapist mother and eccentric house-husband father. The tension rapidly mounts as the mismatched families struggle to get along. Comedy sequel, starring Ben Stiller, Robert De Niro, Dustin Hoffman and Barbra Streisand

programme.title: Official Competition
programme.desc: A wealthy businessman appoints a famous film-maker to make him a smash-hit film. Two of the actors hired for the project hate each other immediately, but that is felt to be a positive thing as the characters they play also despise each other. Comedy drama, starring Penelope Cruz, Antonio Banderas and Oscar Martinez. In Spanish

Its all very enthusiastic and eager to please, but rather daft. Still, its a good way to spend an afternoon. Don Murray, Guy Stockwell and Abby Dalton star as the trio, with Leslie Nielsen as General Custer

programme.desc: The Cannons look after an injured relative, not realising he is wanted for murder

programme.title: Rawhide
programme.desc: Outlaws hold staff and a passenger and her baby hostage at a remote stagecoach station while awaiting the arrival of a shipment of $100,000 in gold bullion. The nervous captives try to stay calm, but the tension between the gang leader and a jumpy henchman grows fraught, ending in a frantic shoot-out - with the infant in the thick of the fray. Western, starring Tyrone Power, Susan Hayward and Jack Elam

programme.desc: A vengeful sheriff tracks down the escaped killer who murdered his family, but in the ensuing confrontation he accidentally shoots an innocent bystander. To make amends, he swears to protect the dead mans widow, whose ranch is under threat from a ruthless land baron. Western, starring Luke Perry, C Thomas Howell, Kim Coates and Jaclyn DeSantis

programme.title: The High Chaparral
programme.desc: Blue and John are far from home when they are captured by Apaches, and must survive in the wilderness without water

programme.title: Ten Wanted Men
programme.desc: A law-abiding Arizona rancher runs into trouble when he unwittingly makes an enemy of a neighbouring landowner, who resents him for having befriended and comforted his abused mistress. The jealous man then recruits nine gunmen in a bid to drive his rival out of the territory. Western, starring Randolph Scott, Richard Boone, Donna Martell and Jocelyn Brando

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The Aidensfield police are puzzled when it seems a face from the past has become the unlikely victim of vandalism, and suspicions are soon aroused over the reasons for his sudden return to the village. Meanwhile, Vernon encounters dangerous wildlife as he stashes his capital in Ashfordly woods, but decides to turn the incident into another money-making scheme. Geoffrey Hughes stars

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Merton faces a race against time to stop a saboteur when Aidensfield hosts a prestigious car hill-climb. Meanwhile, Bernie finds an old car in a cowshed and decides to renovate it, giving Vernon his chance to scoop the winnings in the event. Rural police drama, starring Duncan Bell, Peter Benson and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When wealthy landowner Gregory Lancasters body goes missing on the night of his death, a sinister web of secrets and lies is exposed in the village of Little Malton. As DCI Barnaby, DS Nelson and new forensic pathologist Kam Karimore investigate the mysterious crime, they find themselves drawn into a macabre world of body-snatching during their quest to identify the perpetrator. Detective drama, starring Neil Dudgeon, Gwilym Lee, Manjinder Virk, Helen Baxendale and Navin Chowdhry

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A tax inspector goes missing as he tries to track down the maker of an illicit, potent cider popular among the residents of Midsomer Abbas. Barnaby and Jones have a murder investigation on their hands when the mans body is found floating in a vat at the villages spring fair, where the duo are sampling the local brew. Pathologist Kate Wilding says the victims injuries look as if he was shaken to death by a giant, and as their inquiries continue, they discover the area is steeped in bizarre local traditions. Guest starring Warren Clarke (Dalziel and Pascoe) and Denise Black (Coronation Street)

programme.title: The Road to Coronation Street
programme.desc: Jane Horrocks and Jessie Wallace star in a one-off drama telling the story of how the long-running soap was born. Tony Warren joins producer Harry Elton and director Derek Bennett as they struggle to create the programme, faced with opposition from ITVs formidable bosses Sidney and Cecil Bernstein, while Margaret Morris begins the hunt for the shows cast. With David Dawson, Stephen Berkoff, Celia Imrie and Lynda Baron

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: DCI Barnaby and DS Winter discover a dead body surrounded by rabbits that have escaped from a local pet show, after someone deliberately freed them from their cages. The pair must work out if this is a sign of rivalry taken too far, or is the killer driven by something darker?

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A seemingly straightforward burglary investigation takes an unexpected turn when the victim is found to be leading a double life and suspicions are raised that the break-in could have been part of an insurance fraud. programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A girl disappears, prompting the police to begin a desperate search, convinced her errant father has snatched her. programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates the murder of social worker Jenny Lister, but figuring out the motive behind the killing of an apparently popular woman proves difficult. However, an infamous past case involving the death of a child appears to hold the key. In her pursuit of the truth, Vera uncovers the failings of an understaffed care system and discovers the secret at the heart of Jennys death - which the killer will stop at nothing to protect. Drama based on the book by Ann Cleeves, starring Brenda Blethyn and David Leon

programme.desc: Data analyst Joel and roofer Ricky get given a one-bed terrace cottage in Castle Donington, Leicestershire, and a budget of £20,000 to realise their dreams of finally owning their own homes. programme.desc: The first host in Edinburgh is property manager and law student Sharon, who has gone for a culinary nod to her Australasian travels, complete with a didgeridoo for good measure. programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Management consultant Anthony provides an evening of fine food, the arrival of a new guest shocks the diners and Ashley gets rather competitive over a game of table-top croquet

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Library worker Carmen hosts the third evening in Edinburgh, serving up posh versions of her childhood favourites, so she asks her guests to come dressed as their 10-year-old selves. At the table, writer Gerald is less than impressed by management consultant Anthony and law student Sharons constant bickering, while teacher Ashleigh confronts Sharon over her old-fashioned views

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Edinburgh, American-born Gerald takes his guests Stateside with a menu of diner classics, but he soon finds himself on the back foot when finicky foodie Anthony gives his grub a grilling. Later theres Presidential name dropping, dubious doppelgangers and as the evening draws to a close, preening and pouting when the diners take part in a bizarre beauty pageant

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

Fussy-eater Sharon, however has a few harsh words to share over her main of wild-caught trout, while museum worker Carmen enjoys a front row seat to the continued bickering between Anthony and Sharon

At dinner, the BandBers reflect on the week and talk about keeping in touch, but theres an uncomfortable silence from one end of the table

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The BandB owners meet for the last time and things get personal when Olivia and Teresa of Mallard House take Harry and Carole to task over their feedback. After dramatic discoveries and cutting comments, the payments are revealed and the winner is announced

He only has a few months to master the instrument before he is on stage with his superstar friend Ed Sheeran, playing in front of 70,000 unsuspecting fans. With his debut rapidly approaching, Chris turns to the performers of Cirque du Soleil, neuroscientist Maya Shankar, and drum wizard Ben Gordon (of rock band Parkway Drive) to find out how to accelerate his learning. Will Chris conquer his lack of musical chops as well as his nerves to pull off this brain-boosting challenge, or will he crash and burn in front of a stadium full of fans?

programme.title: Sonic Prime
programme.desc: The wise-cracking blue hedgehog, made famous by a series of popular video games on Sega consoles, continues his computer-animated adventures through the Shatterverse. At the end of the first series, the eponymous spiny mammal (voiced by Deven Mack) learnt from black hedgehog Shadow (Ian Hanlin) that the original version of Green Hill no longer exists. Sonic is trapped in a multiverse of mayhem with different iterations of his friends Amy Rose (Shannon Chan-Kent), Knuckles (Adam Nurada), Rouge (Kazumi Evans) and Tails (Ashleigh Ball). Sonic and Shadow must put aside their differences and work together to repair the temporal damage and outwit diabolical scientist Dr Eggman (Brian Drummond)

programme.title: Tales of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
programme.desc: The heroes in a half shell come to terms with their new roles as saviours of New York City in an animated series set shortly after the events chronicled in the film Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Mutant Mayhem. Donatello (voiced by Micah Abbey), Leonardo (Nicolas Cantu), Michelangelo (Shamon Brown Jr) and Raphael (Brady Noon) experience the usual growing pains of teenagers while contending with the media spotlight. Building on their friendship with aspiring reporter April ONeil (Ayo Edebiri), the reptilian quartet face brilliant inventor Bishop (Alanna Ubach), who believes mutants are the greatest danger facing humankind and must be eliminated. Meanwhile, pampered rich kid Rod (Pete Davison) yearns to be a mutant and leverages his wealth and connections to achieve a dangerous dream

programme.desc: The Scottish adventure continues for Steven Moore and Natasha Raskin Sharp. The pricey purchase of some militaria proves costly and an unassuming lantern attracts big bids

programme.title: The Yorkshire Auction House
programme.desc: The team clears out the home of a retired couple who own an impressive collection of Ladderax furniture, while Angus Ashworth sees potential in some commemorative coins

programme.title: Long Lost Family: Born Without Trace
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell reopen the case of two foundlings left either side of the Irish border, as more shocking secrets are uncovered

programme.title: Long Lost Family: What Happened Next
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell revisit more of the programmes most memorable searches, catching up with three people whose lives have been transformed in ways they never imagined. Those featured are Cathie Cutler Evans, who was desperate to find the birth mother who had given her up for adoption nearly 50 years earlier, as well as John Ayton, who longed to find his father Kenneth after being adopted as a baby, and Maureen Charlton, who came to the programme looking for her brother Michael

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and his team of experts meet Liz from Dorset who brings in a crumbling cast-iron gate built by her brother as a gift for her and her late husband. Horologist Steve Fletcher and leather expert Suzie Fletcher are brought a century-old watch by Nancy whos father was awarded the watch for his bravery on his return from the First World War. Upholsterer Sonnaz Nooranvary takes on a rocking chair that has been at the heart of Annas family home for decades and is in desperate need of some TLC. Last into the shop is Ruth and her Auntie Roz who bring in a penny arcade game from the 1920s

programme.title: Help! My House Is Haunted

programme.title: The Guest Wing
programme.desc: Documentary following stately home owners who hire out their estates to earn extra income, and the clients who pay to use their properties for functions including stag parties, weddings and hunting trips. The programme explores how the reality of life in Britains grand houses is often less glamorous than it appears, as proprietors struggle to maintain crumbling buildings and pay utility bills, and examines the modern-day divide between domestic staff and their employers. Featuring life at Chillingham Castle, Maunsel House, Carlton Towers and Muncaster Castle

programme.title: Richard E Grants Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor explores Berlin, visiting the arty Propeller Island City Lodge - a hotel where guests can fulfil their fantasies by sleeping in lion cages, coffins or rotating beds. However, a naval bombardment leads to several casualties - and when it is followed by a major assault on the airfield, Basilone and his men are pushed to the limits of their endurance as they try to defend their territory. Second World War drama, starring Jon Seda

programme.title: The Penguin
